Question
========

Adam performs a one-way ANOVA with the null hypothesis $H_{0}: \mu_{1} = \mu_{2} = \mu_{3}$ and the alternative hypothesis $H_{A}: \mu_{i} \neq \mu_{j}$.

Which hypothesis is being tested here? Explain in words.

Answerlist
----------
* He is testing whether the three sample averages differ from each other.
* He tests whether two or three groups in a sample differ from each other.
* He tests whether at least one of the three population averages is different from 0.
* He tests whether at least one pair of population averages is different from each other.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
* Correct
